mechanismOfAction: Stimulates insulin secretion and suppresses glucagon release in a glucose-dependent manner
inclusionCriteria: Adults aged 18-75 years; Diagnosis of T2DM for at least 6 months; HbA1c between 7.5% and 10.5%; BMI 25-40 kg/m²; On stable metformin therapy for at least 3 months
exclusionCriteria: Type 1 diabetes; History of diabetic ketoacidosis; Severe renal impairment (eGFR <30 mL/min); Active liver disease; Pregnancy or breastfeeding; History of pancreatitis
primaryEndpoints: Change in HbA1c from baseline to week 26
secondaryEndpoints: Proportion achieving HbA1c <7.0%; Change in fasting plasma glucose; Change in body weight; Time to rescue medication; Safety and tolerability
outcomeMeasurementTool: Laboratory analysis (HbA1c, FPG); Body weight measurements; Adverse event monitoring
studyDuration: 26 weeks treatment period plus 4 weeks safety follow-up

additionalNotes.rescueTherapy: Available after week 12 for patients with FPG >270 mg/dL or HbA1c >10%
additionalNotes.safetyMonitoring: Monthly safety assessments including vital signs, ECG, and laboratory parameters
